status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Weird. I have never encountered this till now. Is there some special case or way of deployment when this happens?
I only see it in our AD-MIT (active directory + mit kerberos) deployment. Have no idea why it makes a difference.

In this setting, yarn-site.xml only defined on gw. On task node, it is empty. So the backend have to get "yarn.resourcemanager.principal" from the jobConf, configuration object from "new Configuration()" will not contain this entry. That's why certain operators such as replicated join fail.
Attach a better fix based on the prio analysis.
WeightedRangePartitioner should still be there. Attach new patch.
Patch committed to both trunk and 0.14 branch. Thanks Rohini for review!
